metadata.description: Known optimal solutions for benchmark problem instances. Used for correctness validation during solver testing and comparison.

solution_format.description: Each solution entry contains the optimal objective value and optionally the optimal flow values

fields.optimal_flow: Optional: Dictionary of arc flows {(tail, head): flow_value}
fields.source: Source of the optimal solution (publication, solver, etc.)
fields.verified_by: Verification method or solver used to confirm optimality

tolerance.description: Numerical tolerance for comparing solver results with known optimal solutions

validation_checks: Flow conservation constraints satisfied at all nodes
Capacity constraints satisfied on all arcs
Optimal basis conditions satisfied (for simplex methods)

reporting.fail_objective: Objective value differs from known optimal by more than tolerance
reporting.fail_feasibility: Solution violates flow conservation or capacity constraints

dimacs_challenge.description: Known optimal solutions published in DIMACS Challenge proceedings
dimacs_challenge.citation: Johnson, D.S. and McGeoch, C.C. (Eds.). Network Flows and Matching: First DIMACS Implementation Challenge. DIMACS Series Volume 12 (1993).

lemon_benchmark.description: Known optimal solutions from LEMON benchmark suite
lemon_benchmark.citation: Péter Kovács. Minimum-cost flow algorithms: an experimental evaluation. Optimization Methods and Software, 30:94-127, 2015.

verified_solvers.description: Solutions verified by multiple independent solvers (OR-Tools, NetworkX, LEMON)

usage_notes.population: This file will be populated in Phase 3+ as problems are downloaded and solutions are verified
usage_notes.verification: Use multiple independent solvers to verify optimal solutions for new problem instances
usage_notes.storage: For large problems, store only objective values to minimize file size. Full flow solutions can be recomputed.
usage_notes.updates: Update this file when new problems are added or when errors in known solutions are discovered
